wikipedia_page.main: Alexander "Alex" McLintock (1853 – 17 May 1931), also known as Sandy McLintock, was a Scottish international footballer who initially played as a defender, but was used as a goalkeeper in the latter stages of his career. He started his career with Vale of Leven and was a part of the side that won three successive Scottish Cup victories. He later played in England with Burnley.

response: * unknown date – Alex McLintock (d. 1931), Scotland international in three matches (1875–1880).

A return to Walsall Swifts followed in the summer of 1883 and two years later he joined Aston Villa via a short spell at Burnley. In 1885 when Jones and Scotland international Alex McLintock played for Burnley against a Blackburn Select XI, it was the first time that two international players had appeared in the same Burnley line-up.
*Alex McLintock (1853–1931), also known as Sandy McLintock, Scottish international footballer
